results.title: Properties of matter. Ep. 1. Solids, liquids and gases
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg illustrates the different forms which water can take; shows how these changes in form depend upon changes in temperature; compares the three divisions of matter, and discusses latent heat and pressure. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Properties of matter
results.creator_credit: Schlessinger Media, First Light Pictures, Olga Palacio, Bob Starner and Tarquin Cardona
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physical science in action”.
Matter is anything and everything that takes up space. This program investigates the different properties of matter - mass, weight, volume and density, as well as the four phases of matter - solid, liquid, gas and plasma. Also introduced is the idea of chemical properties to further help describe and understand the world we live in. Suitable for Upper primary/lower secondary students. Teachers notes included.

results.title: Proper winter clothing
results.creator_credit: Moreland-Latchford Productions, James McCormick and Norman Keziere
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survival in the Wilderness”.
Skiers, hikers and other winter outdoor people learn quickly that it is not how much you have on but what you wear and how you wear it. this film provides the necessary clues to keeping you warm during outdoor travel in winter.

results.title: Proper summer bush clothing
results.creator_credit: Moreland-Latchford Productions, Hugh Moreland and Norman Keziere
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Survival in the Wilderness”.
Two boys head off on a fishing trip, one wearing correct clothing, and the other, ordinary light summer weight slacks and shirt. As the film progresses, the viewer sees that proper clothing is essential to one’s comfort and well-being when camping out.

results.title: Propaganda: resource material from WW1 and WW2.
results.brief_description: This video presents black and white propaganda footage from WW1 and WW2. Part 1 presents excerpts from World War I propaganda in Germany and Australia. Shows early animation/political cartoons by Harry Julius and an excerpt from a Charlie Chaplin film “The Liberty Bond”. Part 2 presents excerpts from World War II propaganda in Australia, Germany and Britain. Includes excerpts by directors Leni Riefenstahl, Humphrey Jennings, Harry Watt and Karl Ritter. The success of cinema propaganda was well established by World War Two. In Germany, Goebbel’s Ministry for National Enlightenment and Propaganda, Britain had its Ministry of Information, in the USA film propaganda was only one part of the total propaganda picture and in Australia we had the Commonwealth Dept. of Information which was responsible for official propaganda and news items.

results.title: Proofreading & editing skills: spelling and usage. Vol.3
results.brief_description: This video seminar presentation led by Debra Smith and Helen Sutton looks at spelling and usage of words in the pursuit of achieving total accuracy in written communication. Areas covered include: a fun test to see how good your spelling is; how and when to use your computer’s spellchecker; capitalisation rules; when to use numbers and when to use words (50 or fifty); 200 frequently misspelled words; frequently misused words; the most commonly confused pairs of words and a proofreading post-test to see how much you’ve learnt.
